text: Olaf Fredrik Watnebryn (4 November 1908 - 6 June 1977) was a Norwegian politician for the Labour Party. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from the Market towns of Buskerud county in 1945, and was re-elected on four occasions. Watnebryn was born in Drammen and a member of Drammen city council in 1934-1937, and of its executive committee in the periods 1937-1940 and 1945-1947\. His career in politics ended with the post of County Governor of Buskerud, which he held from 1962 to 1969. ==References== * Category:1908 births Category:1977 deaths Category:Labour Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Olaf Watnebryn
